jobs.title: AI Operations Intern
jobs.descriptionHtml:
about us

At telli we are building AI voice agents that are reshaping an entire industry.

Since launching 8-months ago, we raised a $3.6M pre-seed round from Cherry and Y Combinator and grew to >$1M in ARR. We are looking for a team members who want to go all-in to help us achieve the next milestone: $10M in ARR.

Two of our co-founders Finn and Philipp previously scaled the heat pump unit of energy unicorn Enpal from 0-150 people. They've seen the ins and outs of scaling phone-based customer processes. These businesses are rushing to deploy AI voice agents. However, creating a demo is easy — building reliable agents that handle millions of calls in production is incredibly hard.

In a world where intelligence becomes a commodity, it is up to us builders to craft new product experiences that let people harness the power of AI.

But building AI voice agents comes with challenges:

  • What is the most intuitive way for humans to build and adjust their own AI agents?

  • How do you build agents that work reliably across millions of calls in a world of non-determinism?

  • How do you ensure that customers can use the latest foundational models without having to understand the technical trade-offs?

  • How do you enable companies to build hybrid teams of human and AI agents?

  • What does human-computer interaction look like if, instead of having UI elements, you have a hyper-intelligent sidekick?

These are unsolved problems. Problems that haven't existed since the invention of computers. Solutions that worked in a pre-LLM world won't work today. Nobody knows how to solve these problems; it's up to us to figure it out.

We’re a small, fully in-person team based in Berlin. Even though most people have told us to build this company in SF because of “better talent” - we know there is amazing talent in Europe. We believe you can build a multi-billion dollar software company in Europe, and there is no better time to do this than now.

about the role

This is the perfect role for someone early in their career (e.g. recent grad) who wants to get deep exposure to how startups operate, work directly with customers, and help scale AI products in the real world.

AI is transforming how companies run their customer communication. As a AI Operations Intern, you’ll work closely with the founders and our customers to make sure everything runs smoothly. You’ll help onboard new customers, support and expand existing ones, and improve the internal processes that make telli scale.

If you’re organized, proactive, and love working at the intersection of product, customer, and operations, this role is for you.

what you’ll be responsible for

  • own full customer journeys including helping onboard and expand customers using our AI agents

  • supporting day-to-day operations and customer communication

  • build custom solutions for clients

  • managing customer feedback and identifying growth opportunities

  • collaborating with product and engineering to improve internal tooling

  • building and documenting scalable processes

  • diving into data and tools (like n8n & Zapier)

  • preparing materials and insights for team and customer meetings

what makes you a great fit

  • you’re a strong communicator in both English and German

  • you’re tech-savvy (or have a semi-technical background) and curious about how AI agent products work

  • you’ve worked on projects or side hustles that show initiative and drive

  • you’re organized, hands-on, and not afraid of doing unglamorous work

  • you love solving problems and figuring things out on your own

  • you’re early in your career and hungry to learn fast

  • you’re excited to help build something from the ground up

you may not make a good fit if…

  • you only want to do high-level “strategic” work

  • you aren’t comfortable juggling multiple tasks at once

  • you don’t enjoy working directly with customers or in dynamic environments

  • you’re not interested in AI, tech, or startups

  • you’re only looking for a typical 9–5 internship
jobs.descriptionPlain:
ABOUT US

At telli we are building AI voice agents that are reshaping an entire industry.

Since launching 8-months ago, we raised a $3.6M pre-seed round from Cherry https://cherry.vc/ and Y Combinator https://www.ycombinator.com/ and grew to >$1M in ARR. We are looking for a team members who want to go all-in to help us achieve the next milestone: $10M in ARR.

Two of our co-founders Finn https://www.linkedin.com/in/finnzurmuehlen/ and Philipp https://www.linkedin.com/in/philippbaumanns/ previously scaled the heat pump unit of energy unicorn Enpal https://www.enpal.d/ from 0-150 people. They've seen the ins and outs of scaling phone-based customer processes. These businesses are rushing to deploy AI voice agents. However, creating a demo is easy — building reliable agents that handle millions of calls in production is incredibly hard.

In a world where intelligence becomes a commodity, it is up to us builders to craft new product experiences that let people harness the power of AI.

But building AI voice agents comes with challenges:

 - What is the most intuitive way for humans to build and adjust their own AI agents?

 - How do you build agents that work reliably across millions of calls in a world of non-determinism?

 - How do you ensure that customers can use the latest foundational models without having to understand the technical trade-offs?

 - How do you enable companies to build hybrid teams of human and AI agents?

 - What does human-computer interaction look like if, instead of having UI elements, you have a hyper-intelligent sidekick?

These are unsolved problems. Problems that haven't existed since the invention of computers. Solutions that worked in a pre-LLM world won't work today. Nobody knows how to solve these problems; it's up to us to figure it out.

We’re a small, fully in-person team based in Berlin. Even though most people have told us to build this company in SF because of “better talent” - we know there is amazing talent in Europe. We believe you can build a multi-billion dollar software company in Europe, and there is no better time to do this than now.



ABOUT THE ROLE

This is the perfect role for someone early in their career (e.g. recent grad) who wants to get deep exposure to how startups operate, work directly with customers, and help scale AI products in the real world.

AI is transforming how companies run their customer communication. As a AI Operations Intern, you’ll work closely with the founders and our customers to make sure everything runs smoothly. You’ll help onboard new customers, support and expand existing ones, and improve the internal processes that make telli scale.

If you’re organized, proactive, and love working at the intersection of product, customer, and operations, this role is for you.


WHAT YOU’LL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR

 - own full customer journeys including helping onboard and expand customers using our AI agents

 - supporting day-to-day operations and customer communication

 - build custom solutions for clients

 - managing customer feedback and identifying growth opportunities

 - collaborating with product and engineering to improve internal tooling

 - building and documenting scalable processes

 - diving into data and tools (like n8n & Zapier)

 - preparing materials and insights for team and customer meetings


WHAT MAKES YOU A GREAT FIT

 - you’re a strong communicator in both English and German

 - you’re tech-savvy (or have a semi-technical background) and curious about how AI agent products work

 - you’ve worked on projects or side hustles that show initiative and drive

 - you’re organized, hands-on, and not afraid of doing unglamorous work

 - you love solving problems and figuring things out on your own

 - you’re early in your career and hungry to learn fast

 - you’re excited to help build something from the ground up


YOU MAY NOT MAKE A GOOD FIT IF…

 - you only want to do high-level “strategic” work

 - you aren’t comfortable juggling multiple tasks at once

 - you don’t enjoy working directly with customers or in dynamic environments

 - you’re not interested in AI, tech, or startups

 - you’re only looking for a typical 9–5 internship

jobs.title: Growth Intern
jobs.descriptionHtml:
about us

At telli we are building AI voice agents that are reshaping an entire industry.

Since launching 8-months ago, we raised a $3.6M pre-seed round from Cherry and Y Combinator and grew to >$1M in ARR. We are looking for a team members who want to go all-in to help us achieve the next milestone: $10M in ARR.

Two of our co-founders Finn and Philipp previously scaled the heat pump unit of energy unicorn Enpal from 0-150 people. They've seen the ins and outs of scaling phone-based customer processes. These businesses are rushing to deploy AI voice agents. However, creating a demo is easy — building reliable agents that handle millions of calls in production is incredibly hard.

In a world where intelligence becomes a commodity, it is up to us builders to craft new product experiences that let people harness the power of AI.

But building AI voice agents comes with challenges:

  • What is the most intuitive way for humans to build and adjust their own AI agents?

  • How do you build agents that work reliably across millions of calls in a world of non-determinism?

  • How do you ensure that customers can use the latest foundational models without having to understand the technical trade-offs?

  • How do you enable companies to build hybrid teams of human and AI agents?

  • What does human-computer interaction look like if, instead of having UI elements, you have a hyper-intelligent sidekick?

These are unsolved problems. Problems that haven't existed since the invention of computers. Solutions that worked in a pre-LLM world won't work today. Nobody knows how to solve these problems; it's up to us to figure it out.

We’re a small, fully in-person team based in Berlin. Even though most people have told us to build this company in SF because of “better talent” - we know there is amazing talent in Europe. We believe you can build a multi-billion dollar software company in Europe, and there is no better time to do this than now.

what you’ll do:

  • help us build out telli’s gtm engine to 10x revenue over the coming year

  • dive into the complete sales cycle: researching leads, engaging prospects, managing conversations, and converting them into customers

  • automate manual work with an AI-first approach

  • interact directly with potential customers, build demos and help them succeed

  • work closely with Badr, Ennie, and Philipp

what makes you a great fit:

  • you are hands-on and not afraid of doing unglamorous work

  • you're tech- & automation savvy (or have technical background) and can learn new tools fast

  • you love solving problems and figuring things out on your own

  • you’re a strong communicator in both English and German

  • you’ve have initial (internship) experience and/or worked on side hustles or projects

  • you're done or at the end of university and could imagine starting full-time after the internship

you may not make a good fit if:

  • you have never touched automation/AI tools or don’t have basic technical understanding

  • you only want to do high-level “strategic” work

  • you aren’t comfortable juggling multiple tasks at once

  • you don’t enjoy working directly with customers or in dynamic environments

  • you’re only looking for a typical 9–5 internship

 - you're done or at the end of university and could imagine starting full-time after the internship


YOU MAY NOT MAKE A GOOD FIT IF:

 - you have never touched automation/AI tools or don’t have basic technical understanding

 - you only want to do high-level “strategic” work

 - you aren’t comfortable juggling multiple tasks at once

 - you don’t enjoy working directly with customers or in dynamic environments

 - you’re only looking for a typical 9–5 internship

jobs.title: AI Operations Associate
jobs.descriptionHtml:
about us

At telli we are building AI voice agents that are reshaping an entire industry.

Since launching 8-months ago, we raised a $3.6M pre-seed round from Cherry and Y Combinator and grew to >$1M in ARR. We are looking for a team members who want to go all-in to help us achieve the next milestone: $10M in ARR.

Two of our co-founders Finn and Philipp previously scaled the heat pump unit of energy unicorn Enpal from 0-150 people. They've seen the ins and outs of scaling phone-based customer processes. These businesses are rushing to deploy AI voice agents. However, creating a demo is easy — building reliable agents that handle millions of calls in production is incredibly hard.

In a world where intelligence becomes a commodity, it is up to us builders to craft new product experiences that let people harness the power of AI.

But building AI voice agents comes with challenges:

  • What is the most intuitive way for humans to build and adjust their own AI agents?

  • How do you build agents that work reliably across millions of calls in a world of non-determinism?

  • How do you ensure that customers can use the latest foundational models without having to understand the technical trade-offs?

  • How do you enable companies to build hybrid teams of human and AI agents?

  • What does human-computer interaction look like if, instead of having UI elements, you have a hyper-intelligent sidekick?

These are unsolved problems. Problems that haven't existed since the invention of computers. Solutions that worked in a pre-LLM world won't work today. Nobody knows how to solve these problems; it's up to us to figure it out.

We’re a small, fully in-person team based in Berlin. Even though most people have told us to build this company in SF because of “better talent” - we know there is amazing talent in Europe. We believe you can build a multi-billion dollar software company in Europe, and there is no better time to do this than now.

your mission

This is a pivotal hire for telli and a career-defining role for a true builder. Your mission: architect our company’s AI-native operating system from first principles. You won’t be running old playbooks; you will be building the intelligent engine designed for one purpose: to deliver a flawless customer experience that scales us to $100M ARR.

what you’ll be responsible for

  • Master the entire customer lifecycle, from designing a seamless onboarding process to driving expansion and renewal, always striving for world-class customer experiences

  • Design, implement, and scale core business processes with an automation-first mindset, using tools like n8n or Zapier to ensure we operate with maximum efficiency

  • Systematically gather, analyze, and champion customer feedback to the founders and our engineering team, directly influencing our product roadmap and identifying new growth opportunities

  • Collaborate closely with engineering to define and improve the internal tools we need to scale effectively and serve our customers better

  • As a foundational member, you will play a key role in defining the culture, processes, and structure of our operations team

what makes you a great fit

  • you are a world-class operator with experience in building and scaling businesses, whether in a hyper-growth startup or your own venture

  • you’re tech-savvy (or have a semi-technical background) and curious about how AI agent products work

  • you are customer obsessed and have a business sense to understand problems, pain points and needs of our customers

  • you have experience in and are enthusiastic about leading initiatives end-to-end

  • you’re are hands-on and not afraid of doing unglamorous work

  • you love solving problems and figuring things out on your own

  • you’re a strong communicator in both German and English

  • you want to work on-site 5 days a week in Berlin

you may not make a good fit if…

  • you need detailed instructions and shy away from taking responsibility

  • you lack experience with automation/AI tools or basic technical understanding

  • you're only interested in high-level "strategic" work

  • you don't enjoy direct customer interaction or thriving in dynamic environments

  • you prefer working remotely

  • you prefer working with minimal collaboration

  • you avoid hands-on, practical work

  • you want to work a 9-5 job
jobs.descriptionPlain:
ABOUT US

At telli we are building AI voice agents that are reshaping an entire industry.

Since launching 8-months ago, we raised a $3.6M pre-seed round from Cherry https://cherry.vc/ and Y Combinator https://www.ycombinator.com/ and grew to >$1M in ARR. We are looking for a team members who want to go all-in to help us achieve the next milestone: $10M in ARR.

Two of our co-founders Finn https://www.linkedin.com/in/finnzurmuehlen/ and Philipp https://www.linkedin.com/in/philippbaumanns/ previously scaled the heat pump unit of energy unicorn Enpal https://www.enpal.d/ from 0-150 people. They've seen the ins and outs of scaling phone-based customer processes. These businesses are rushing to deploy AI voice agents. However, creating a demo is easy — building reliable agents that handle millions of calls in production is incredibly hard.

In a world where intelligence becomes a commodity, it is up to us builders to craft new product experiences that let people harness the power of AI.

But building AI voice agents comes with challenges:

 - What is the most intuitive way for humans to build and adjust their own AI agents?

 - How do you build agents that work reliably across millions of calls in a world of non-determinism?

 - How do you ensure that customers can use the latest foundational models without having to understand the technical trade-offs?

 - How do you enable companies to build hybrid teams of human and AI agents?

 - What does human-computer interaction look like if, instead of having UI elements, you have a hyper-intelligent sidekick?

These are unsolved problems. Problems that haven't existed since the invention of computers. Solutions that worked in a pre-LLM world won't work today. Nobody knows how to solve these problems; it's up to us to figure it out.

We’re a small, fully in-person team based in Berlin. Even though most people have told us to build this company in SF because of “better talent” - we know there is amazing talent in Europe. We believe you can build a multi-billion dollar software company in Europe, and there is no better time to do this than now.



YOUR MISSION

This is a pivotal hire for telli and a career-defining role for a true builder. Your mission: architect our company’s AI-native operating system from first principles. You won’t be running old playbooks; you will be building the intelligent engine designed for one purpose: to deliver a flawless customer experience that scales us to $100M ARR.


WHAT YOU’LL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR

 - Master the entire customer lifecycle, from designing a seamless onboarding process to driving expansion and renewal, always striving for world-class customer experiences

 - Design, implement, and scale core business processes with an automation-first mindset, using tools like n8n or Zapier to ensure we operate with maximum efficiency

 - Systematically gather, analyze, and champion customer feedback to the founders and our engineering team, directly influencing our product roadmap and identifying new growth opportunities

 - Collaborate closely with engineering to define and improve the internal tools we need to scale effectively and serve our customers better

 - As a foundational member, you will play a key role in defining the culture, processes, and structure of our operations team


WHAT MAKES YOU A GREAT FIT

 - you are a world-class operator with experience in building and scaling businesses, whether in a hyper-growth startup or your own venture

 - you’re tech-savvy (or have a semi-technical background) and curious about how AI agent products work

 - you are customer obsessed and have a business sense to understand problems, pain points and needs of our customers

 - you have experience in and are enthusiastic about leading initiatives end-to-end

 - you’re are hands-on and not afraid of doing unglamorous work

 - you love solving problems and figuring things out on your own

 - you’re a strong communicator in both German and English

 - you want to work on-site 5 days a week in Berlin
   


YOU MAY NOT MAKE A GOOD FIT IF…

 - you need detailed instructions and shy away from taking responsibility

 - you lack experience with automation/AI tools or basic technical understanding

 - you're only interested in high-level "strategic" work

 - you don't enjoy direct customer interaction or thriving in dynamic environments

 - you prefer working remotely

 - you prefer working with minimal collaboration

 - you avoid hands-on, practical work

 - you want to work a 9-5 job

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
about us

At telli we are building AI voice agents that are reshaping an entire industry.

Since launching 8-months ago, we raised a $3.6M pre-seed round from Cherry and Y Combinator and grew to >$1M in ARR. We are looking for a team members who want to go all-in to help us achieve the next milestone: $10M in ARR.

Two of our co-founders Finn and Philipp previously scaled the heat pump unit of energy unicorn Enpal from 0-150 people. They've seen the ins and outs of scaling phone-based customer processes. These businesses are rushing to deploy AI voice agents. However, creating a demo is easy — building reliable agents that handle millions of calls in production is incredibly hard.

In a world where intelligence becomes a commodity, it is up to us builders to craft new product experiences that let people harness the power of AI.

But building AI voice agents comes with challenges:

  • What is the most intuitive way for humans to build and adjust their own AI agents?

  • How do you build agents that work reliably across millions of calls in a world of non-determinism?

  • How do you ensure that customers can use the latest foundational models without having to understand the technical trade-offs?

  • How do you enable companies to build hybrid teams of human and AI agents?

  • What does human-computer interaction look like if, instead of having UI elements, you have a hyper-intelligent sidekick?

These are unsolved problems. Problems that haven't existed since the invention of computers. Solutions that worked in a pre-LLM world won't work today. Nobody knows how to solve these problems; it's up to us to figure it out.

We’re a small, fully in-person team based in Berlin. Even though most people have told us to build this company in SF because of “better talent” - we know there is amazing talent in Europe. We believe you can build a multi-billion dollar software company in Europe, and there is no better time to do this than now.

about the role

This is a high-ownership, high-impact role for engineers who care about velocity and solving real customer problems. You won't just ship code; you will own projects end-to-end, make core product and architectural decisions, and shape the future of this company.

We believe in building a small A* engineering team. We plan to keep the core engineering team small, even while we scale and rely on engineers who have super high impact on the growth of the company.

That is why to succeed, you need to be comfortable with working on any part of our stack. One week you might be polishing the UX of our frontend, the next week dive deep into async processing challenges of our voice AI infrastructure If you only want to work on a specific technology/part of the product, this might not be the right role for you.

Right now our engineering team consists of Paulus, Philipp, Błażej, and Seb.


what you will do

  • work closely with our customers, understand their problems, and come up with product experiences that solve their challenges

  • build scalable backend infrastructure to handle thousands of AI phone calls a day

  • build intuitive user experiences that make sense in an AI-first world

  • own high stakes projects end-to-end


tech stack

Our tech stack includes TypeScript, React, TanStack, Node, Python, Postgres as well as Temporal.io, Twilio, and Modal. But more than familiarity with any specific technology, we value a how fast you can learn and the ability to ship end-to-end features.

what makes you a great fit

  • you align with our principles

  • you love challenging work and consistently go above and beyond

  • you take full ownership of projects

  • you want to work in-person in Berlin

  • you know what it takes to succeed in a fast-paced, high-ambiguity environment and ideally worked in an early stage startup

  • you know how to prioritize high-leverage work

  • you want to work with a smart and driven team with (self-reported) low ego

  • you want to help build a multi-billion dollar company from the ground up

you may not make a good fit if…

  • you prefer a remote-first environment

  • you like to work on your own with minimum collaboration

  • you have no prior experience in software engineering teams

  • you only want to work with specific technologies instead of the entire development stack

  • you think AI is just "hype" and doesn’t provide real value

  • you want to work 9-5

perks

  • above-market pay & equity

  • access to any (AI) tool that makes you more productive

  • gym subscription

  • company trip to San Francisco in fall 2025

Our tech stack includes TypeScript, React, TanStack, Node, Python, Postgres as well as Temporal.io http://Temporal.io, Twilio https://www.twilio.com, and Modal https://modal.com/. But more than familiarity with any specific technology, we value a how fast you can learn and the ability to ship end-to-end features.


WHAT MAKES YOU A GREAT FIT

 - you align with our principles https://principles.telli.com/

 - you love challenging work and consistently go above and beyond

 - you take full ownership of projects

 - you want to work in-person in Berlin

 - you know what it takes to succeed in a fast-paced, high-ambiguity environment and ideally worked in an early stage startup

 - you know how to prioritize high-leverage work

 - you want to work with a smart and driven team with (self-reported) low ego

 - you want to help build a multi-billion dollar company from the ground up


YOU MAY NOT MAKE A GOOD FIT IF…

 - you prefer a remote-first environment

 - you like to work on your own with minimum collaboration

 - you have no prior experience in software engineering teams

 - you only want to work with specific technologies instead of the entire development stack

 - you think AI is just "hype" and doesn’t provide real value

 - you want to work 9-5
   


PERKS

 - above-market pay & equity

 - access to any (AI) tool that makes you more productive

 - gym subscription

 - company trip to San Francisco in fall 2025

jobs.title: Founding Designer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
about us

At telli we are building AI voice agents that are reshaping an entire industry.

Since launching 8-months ago, we raised a $3.6M pre-seed round from Cherry and Y Combinator and grew to >$1M in ARR. We are looking for a team members who want to go all-in to help us achieve the next milestone: $10M in ARR.

Two of our co-founders Finn and Philipp previously scaled the heat pump unit of energy unicorn Enpal from 0-150 people. They've seen the ins and outs of scaling phone-based customer processes. These businesses are rushing to deploy AI voice agents. However, creating a demo is easy — building reliable agents that handle millions of calls in production is incredibly hard.

In a world where intelligence becomes a commodity, it is up to us builders to craft new product experiences that let people harness the power of AI.

But building AI voice agents comes with challenges:

  • What is the most intuitive way for humans to build and adjust their own AI agents?

  • How do you build agents that work reliably across millions of calls in a world of non-determinism?

  • How do you ensure that customers can use the latest foundational models without having to understand the technical trade-offs?

  • How do you enable companies to build hybrid teams of human and AI agents?

  • What does human-computer interaction look like if, instead of having UI elements, you have a hyper-intelligent sidekick?

These are unsolved problems. Problems that haven't existed since the invention of computers. Solutions that worked in a pre-LLM world won't work today. Nobody knows how to solve these problems; it's up to us to figure it out.

We’re a small, fully in-person team based in Berlin. Even though most people have told us to build this company in SF because of “better talent” - we know there is amazing talent in Europe. We believe you can build a multi-billion dollar software company in Europe, and there is no better time to do this than now.

about the role

This is a high-ownership role for a founding designer who cares about velocity and solving real customer problems. You won't just create mockups, you will own the entire design process end-to-end, speaking directly to customers and making core product and UX decisions. In short, you’ll have a significant impact on the direction of our high-growth, ambitious product.

You'll be our first full-time designer — with ownership over UX and UI across the entire product. This means you need to be comfortable designing for complex, AI-first workflows while maintaining the simplicity that makes our product accessible to non-technical users.


what you will do

  • work closely with our customers, understand their problems, and design product experiences that solve their challenges

  • own the end-to-end design process for features that process and analyze thousands of AI phone calls a day

  • build prototypes and test product hypothesis with customers

  • create intuitive interfaces that make sense in an AI-first world where traditional UI patterns don't apply

  • collaborate directly with engineers to ship high-quality features quickly

  • lead user research projects across the company


your profile

  • you have worked as a product designer, ideally in an early-stage company

  • you love speaking to customers directly to identify pain points and problems

  • you have owned the development of product features, ideally in B2B

  • you feel comfortable shipping frontend changes (React/Tailwind) to production

  • you don't just express designs in Figma, but also feel comfortable with tools like v0, Lovable, Cursor, etc. to build usable prototypes

  • you're a high-agency generalist who can work across the entire product

  • you have a deep interest in AI and large language models and are excited about the unique design challenges of voice AI interfaces

  • have thrived in high-ambiguity environments: resolving uncertainty, embracing failure, and crystallizing what matters

  • care about building reliable, production-ready experiences (not just demos), but aren’t afraid to dive immediately into a problem and prototype without needing too much input


what makes you a great fit

  • you align with our principles

  • you take full ownership of projects

  • you want to work in-person in Berlin

  • you know what it takes to succeed in a fast-paced, high-ambiguity environment

  • you know how to prioritize high-leverage work

  • you want to work with a smart and driven team with (self-reported) low ego

  • you want to help build a multi-billion dollar company from the ground up

  • strong portfolio showcasing your work on complex, user-centered products

  • proficiency in modern design tools (Figma, etc.)

  • experience designing for both web and mobile platforms

  • (bonus) you speak German natively (our biggest customers are German-speaking)


you may not make a good fit if…

  • you prefer a remote-first environment

  • you like to work on your own with minimum collaboration

  • you have no prior experience in software engineering teams

  • you only want to work on visual design instead of the entire user experience

  • you think AI is just "hype" and doesn't provide real value

  • you want to work 9-5

perks

  • above-market pay & equity

  • access to any (AI) tool that makes you more productive

  • gym subscription

  • company trip to San Francisco in fall 2025

WHAT MAKES YOU A GREAT FIT

 - you align with our principles

 - you want to work in-person in Berlin

 - you know how to prioritize high-leverage work

 - you want to work with a smart and driven team with (self-reported) low ego

 - you want to help build a multi-billion dollar company from the ground up

 - strong portfolio showcasing your work on complex, user-centered products

 - proficiency in modern design tools (Figma, etc.)

 - experience designing for both web and mobile platforms

 - (bonus) you speak German natively (our biggest customers are German-speaking)



YOU MAY NOT MAKE A GOOD FIT IF…

 - you prefer a remote-first environment

 - you like to work on your own with minimum collaboration

 - you have no prior experience in software engineering teams

 - you only want to work on visual design instead of the entire user experience

 - you think AI is just "hype" and doesn't provide real value

 - you want to work 9-5


PERKS

 - access to any (AI) tool that makes you more productive

 - gym subscription

 - company trip to San Francisco in fall 2025

jobs.title: Forward Deployed Engineer (AI)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
about us

At telli we are building AI voice agents that are reshaping an entire industry.

Since launching 8-months ago, we raised a $3.6M pre-seed round from Cherry and Y Combinator and grew to >$1M in ARR. We are looking for a team members who want to go all-in to help us achieve the next milestone: $10M in ARR.

Two of our co-founders Finn and Philipp previously scaled the heat pump unit of energy unicorn Enpal from 0-150 people. They've seen the ins and outs of scaling phone-based customer processes. These businesses are rushing to deploy AI voice agents. However, creating a demo is easy — building reliable agents that handle millions of calls in production is incredibly hard.

In a world where intelligence becomes a commodity, it is up to us builders to craft new product experiences that let people harness the power of AI.

But building AI voice agents comes with challenges:

  • What is the most intuitive way for humans to build and adjust their own AI agents?

  • How do you build agents that work reliably across millions of calls in a world of non-determinism?

  • How do you ensure that customers can use the latest foundational models without having to understand the technical trade-offs?

  • How do you enable companies to build hybrid teams of human and AI agents?

  • What does human-computer interaction look like if, instead of having UI elements, you have a hyper-intelligent sidekick?

These are unsolved problems. Problems that haven't existed since the invention of computers. Solutions that worked in a pre-LLM world won't work today. Nobody knows how to solve these problems; it's up to us to figure it out.

We’re a small, fully in-person team based in Berlin. Even though most people have told us to build this company in SF because of “better talent” - we know there is amazing talent in Europe. We believe you can build a multi-billion dollar software company in Europe, and there is no better time to do this than now.

about the role

This is the perfect role for someone with an engineering background (e.g. recent CS grad, engineering bootcamp, business informatics) who wants to use their technical skills in an applied customer-facing/commercial role.

AI is changing how customers buy software. Many companies want to use AI but don't know how to best integrate these new technologies into their business workflows. As a Forward Deployed Engineer, you are the face of telli in front of our customers. You will shape how our customers get onboarded, integrate telli into their systems, and help develop business workflows to ensure the highest quality and performance of our agents.

If you’re technical, have strong communication skills, and can organize unstructured information well, you’ll be great for this role.


what you’ll be responsible for

  • owning communication with customers

  • helping customers build and develop telli agents that handle thousands of calls a day

  • shape and automate customer onboarding processes

  • support customers with prompt engineering

  • translate customer learnings to inform what we build next

  • debug technical issues


what makes you a great fit

  • you have a software engineering background (CS degree, worked as a software engineer, did a bootcamp, or built software projects)

  • you’re an excellent communicator in both English and German (additional languages are a big plus)

  • you’ve built AI agents and understand topics like prompt engineering and evals

  • you’re great at translating what customers say into what they actually mean

  • you’re on top of the newest AI trends and have tinkered a lot with AI

  • you are open to occasionally travel within Europe to customers

  • you’re still early in your career and hungry to learn

  • you want to help build a multi-billion dollar company from the ground up


you may not make a good fit if…

  • you can only write code with the help of AI

  • you have a pure business background but want to transition to tech

  • you only like ‘strategic’ work and don’t want to get your hands dirty

  • you don’t understand how web applications & APIs work under the hood

  • you want to work 9–5

perks

  • above-market pay & equity

  • access to any (AI) tool that makes you more productive

  • gym subscription

  • company trip to San Francisco in fall 2025
jobs.descriptionPlain:
ABOUT US

At telli we are building AI voice agents that are reshaping an entire industry.

Since launching 8-months ago, we raised a $3.6M pre-seed round from Cherry https://cherry.vc/ and Y Combinator https://www.ycombinator.com/ and grew to >$1M in ARR. We are looking for a team members who want to go all-in to help us achieve the next milestone: $10M in ARR.

Two of our co-founders Finn https://www.linkedin.com/in/finnzurmuehlen/ and Philipp https://www.linkedin.com/in/philippbaumanns/ previously scaled the heat pump unit of energy unicorn Enpal https://www.enpal.d/ from 0-150 people. They've seen the ins and outs of scaling phone-based customer processes. These businesses are rushing to deploy AI voice agents. However, creating a demo is easy — building reliable agents that handle millions of calls in production is incredibly hard.

In a world where intelligence becomes a commodity, it is up to us builders to craft new product experiences that let people harness the power of AI.

But building AI voice agents comes with challenges:

 - What is the most intuitive way for humans to build and adjust their own AI agents?

 - How do you build agents that work reliably across millions of calls in a world of non-determinism?

 - How do you ensure that customers can use the latest foundational models without having to understand the technical trade-offs?

 - How do you enable companies to build hybrid teams of human and AI agents?

 - What does human-computer interaction look like if, instead of having UI elements, you have a hyper-intelligent sidekick?

These are unsolved problems. Problems that haven't existed since the invention of computers. Solutions that worked in a pre-LLM world won't work today. Nobody knows how to solve these problems; it's up to us to figure it out.

We’re a small, fully in-person team based in Berlin. Even though most people have told us to build this company in SF because of “better talent” - we know there is amazing talent in Europe. We believe you can build a multi-billion dollar software company in Europe, and there is no better time to do this than now.



ABOUT THE ROLE

This is the perfect role for someone with an engineering background (e.g. recent CS grad, engineering bootcamp, business informatics) who wants to use their technical skills in an applied customer-facing/commercial role.

AI is changing how customers buy software. Many companies want to use AI but don't know how to best integrate these new technologies into their business workflows. As a Forward Deployed Engineer https://youtu.be/DL82mGde6wo?feature=shared&t=1158, you are the face of telli in front of our customers. You will shape how our customers get onboarded, integrate telli into their systems, and help develop business workflows to ensure the highest quality and performance of our agents.


If you’re technical, have strong communication skills, and can organize unstructured information well, you’ll be great for this role.



WHAT YOU’LL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR

 - owning communication with customers

 - helping customers build and develop telli agents that handle thousands of calls a day

 - shape and automate customer onboarding processes

 - support customers with prompt engineering

 - translate customer learnings to inform what we build next

 - debug technical issues



WHAT MAKES YOU A GREAT FIT

 - you have a software engineering background (CS degree, worked as a software engineer, did a bootcamp, or built software projects)

 - you’re an excellent communicator in both English and German (additional languages are a big plus)

 - you’ve built AI agents and understand topics like prompt engineering and evals

 - you’re great at translating what customers say into what they actually mean

 - you’re on top of the newest AI trends and have tinkered a lot with AI

 - you are open to occasionally travel within Europe to customers

 - you’re still early in your career and hungry to learn

 - you want to help build a multi-billion dollar company from the ground up



YOU MAY NOT MAKE A GOOD FIT IF…

 - you can only write code with the help of AI

 - you have a pure business background but want to transition to tech

 - you only like ‘strategic’ work and don’t want to get your hands dirty

 - you don’t understand how web applications & APIs work under the hood

 - you want to work 9–5


PERKS

 - above-market pay & equity

 - access to any (AI) tool that makes you more productive

 - gym subscription

 - company trip to San Francisco in fall 2025

jobs.title: Growth Associate
jobs.descriptionHtml:
about us

At telli we are building AI voice agents that are reshaping an entire industry.

Since launching 8-months ago, we raised a $3.6M pre-seed round from Cherry and Y Combinator and grew to >$1M in ARR. We are looking for a team members who want to go all-in to help us achieve the next milestone: $10M in ARR.

Two of our co-founders Finn and Philipp previously scaled the heat pump unit of energy unicorn Enpal from 0-150 people. They've seen the ins and outs of scaling phone-based customer processes. These businesses are rushing to deploy AI voice agents. However, creating a demo is easy — building reliable agents that handle millions of calls in production is incredibly hard.

In a world where intelligence becomes a commodity, it is up to us builders to craft new product experiences that let people harness the power of AI.

But building AI voice agents comes with challenges:

  • What is the most intuitive way for humans to build and adjust their own AI agents?

  • How do you build agents that work reliably across millions of calls in a world of non-determinism?

  • How do you ensure that customers can use the latest foundational models without having to understand the technical trade-offs?

  • How do you enable companies to build hybrid teams of human and AI agents?

  • What does human-computer interaction look like if, instead of having UI elements, you have a hyper-intelligent sidekick?

These are unsolved problems. Problems that haven't existed since the invention of computers. Solutions that worked in a pre-LLM world won't work today. Nobody knows how to solve these problems; it's up to us to figure it out.

We’re a small, fully in-person team based in Berlin. Even though most people have told us to build this company in SF because of “better talent” - we know there is amazing talent in Europe. We believe you can build a multi-billion dollar software company in Europe, and there is no better time to do this than now.

what you’ll do:

  • play a significant part in creating telli’s gtm engine to help 10x telli’s revenue over the next year

  • take full ownership of key growth channels and optimize them

  • discover and experiment with new growth initiatives and markets

  • build and manage own relationships with customers

  • drive the complete sales cycle: generating, qualifying and closing customers end-to-end (how much sales you do is for you to decide)

  • be part of building out the founding growth team

  • build processes with an AI automation-first approach

what makes you a great fit:

  • you have experience in building or scaling companies either in a startup environment or in own projects (ideally in a growth setting)

  • you have strong customer empathy and business sense to understand problems, pain points and needs of different companies

  • you have experience in and enthusiastic about leading initiatives end-to-end

  • you’re are hands-on and not afraid of doing unglamorous work

  • you love solving problems and figuring things out on your own

  • you’re a strong communicator in both English and German

  • you want to work with smart and friendly people with (self-reported) low ego

  • you want to work on-site 5 days a week in Berlin

you may not make a good fit if…

  • you need detailed instructions and shy away from taking responsibility

  • you lack experience with automation/AI tools or basic technical understanding

  • you're only interested in high-level "strategic" work

  • you don't enjoy direct customer interaction or thriving in dynamic environments

  • you prefer working remotely

  • you prefer working with minimal collaboration

  • you avoid hands-on, practical work

  • you want to work a 9-5 job

jobs.title: Growth Hacker Intern
jobs.descriptionHtml:
about us

At telli we are building AI voice agents that are reshaping an entire industry.

Since launching 8-months ago, we raised a $3.6M pre-seed round from Cherry and Y Combinator and grew to >$1M in ARR. We are looking for a team members who want to go all-in to help us achieve the next milestone: $10M in ARR.

Two of our co-founders Finn and Philipp previously scaled the heat pump unit of energy unicorn Enpal from 0-150 people. They've seen the ins and outs of scaling phone-based customer processes. These businesses are rushing to deploy AI voice agents. However, creating a demo is easy — building reliable agents that handle millions of calls in production is incredibly hard.

In a world where intelligence becomes a commodity, it is up to us builders to craft new product experiences that let people harness the power of AI.

But building AI voice agents comes with challenges:

  • What is the most intuitive way for humans to build and adjust their own AI agents?

  • How do you build agents that work reliably across millions of calls in a world of non-determinism?

  • How do you ensure that customers can use the latest foundational models without having to understand the technical trade-offs?

  • How do you enable companies to build hybrid teams of human and AI agents?

  • What does human-computer interaction look like if, instead of having UI elements, you have a hyper-intelligent sidekick?

These are unsolved problems. Problems that haven't existed since the invention of computers. Solutions that worked in a pre-LLM world won't work today. Nobody knows how to solve these problems; it's up to us to figure it out.

We’re a small, fully in-person team based in Berlin. Even though most people have told us to build this company in SF because of “better talent” - we know there is amazing talent in Europe. We believe you can build a multi-billion dollar software company in Europe, and there is no better time to do this than now.

what you’ll do

  • play a significant part in creating telli’s gtm engine to help 10x telli’s revenue over the next year

  • own the full inbound growth funnel: from creating product marketing and content that resonate with our audience to scaling lead generation through SEO/GEO and paid campaigns with external partners

  • track, analyze, and optimize performance metrics to guide data-driven decisions

  • automate manual growth workflows with an AI-first approach

  • work closely with Badr, Ennie, and Philipp to align growth marketing with sales and product execution

what makes you a great fit

  • you have a growth hacker mentality and have demonstrated your ability to reach audiences through successful projects, social presence, or measurable growth results

  • you're creative and come up with original ideas

  • you're comfortable analyzing metrics, running tests, and iterating based on results

  • you're tech- & automation-savvy and can quickly learn new tools to streamline your work

  • you love solving problems and figuring things out on your own

  • you’ve have initial (internship) experience and/or worked on side hustles or projects

  • you're done or at the end of university and could imagine starting full-time after the internship

you may not be a good fit if:

  • you don't enjoy creating content like blog posts, social media, landing pages, and product messaging

  • you're not excited about testing multiple channels simultaneously and learning from what fails

  • you're uncomfortable with data, analytics, or making decisions based on metrics

  • you have never touched automation/AI tools or don’t have basic technical understanding

  • you only want to do high-level “strategic” work

  • you’re only looking for a typical 9–5 internship

ABOUT US

At telli we are building AI voice agents that are reshaping an entire industry.

Since launching 8-months ago, we raised a $3.6M pre-seed round from Cherry https://cherry.vc/ and Y Combinator https://www.ycombinator.com/ and grew to >$1M in ARR. We are looking for a team members who want to go all-in to help us achieve the next milestone: $10M in ARR.

 - work closely with Badr, Ennie, and Philipp to align growth marketing with sales and product execution


WHAT MAKES YOU A GREAT FIT

 - you have a growth hacker mentality and have demonstrated your ability to reach audiences through successful projects, social presence, or measurable growth results

 - you're creative and come up with original ideas

 - you're comfortable analyzing metrics, running tests, and iterating based on results

 - you're tech- & automation-savvy and can quickly learn new tools to streamline your work

 - you love solving problems and figuring things out on your own

 - you’ve have initial (internship) experience and/or worked on side hustles or projects

 - you're done or at the end of university and could imagine starting full-time after the internship


YOU MAY NOT BE A GOOD FIT IF:

 - you don't enjoy creating content like blog posts, social media, landing pages, and product messaging

 - you're not excited about testing multiple channels simultaneously and learning from what fails

 - you're uncomfortable with data, analytics, or making decisions based on metrics

 - you have never touched automation/AI tools or don’t have basic technical understanding

 - you only want to do high-level “strategic” work

 - you’re only looking for a typical 9–5 internship
